overview:
Michael Critchfield joined InsideSales.com in May 2010 with 25 years of experience in public and private high-tech and emerging SaaS companies.

He is currently responsible for strategic planning, corporate leadership, and execution of net sales revenue at InsideSales.com for enterprise, mid-market, small-to-medium, inbound and outbound business development, and customer account managers.

Prior to InsideSales.com Michael served as Chief Operating Officer and Vice President of Sales and Marketing at Velosum, Inc., a provider of a SaaS-based digital pen and paper technology. Prior to Velosum, he served as a founder and Vice President of Sales at Arkona, Inc., the technology leader in SaaS-based management solutions for automobile dealerships, which was purchased by DealerTrack in June of 2007. Michael also worked in sales and service capacities at Word Perfect, Novell, Corel, Vinca, Legato and Manage.com. Michael was recognized among the Top 25 Most Influential Inside Sales Professionals in 2012 by the American Association of Inside Sales Professionals (AA-ISP) and currently serves as the President of the Salt Lake City Chapter of AA-ISP.

Michael began his career in the U.S. Army and Utah National Guard with a background in Logistics and Counter Intelligence. Michael attended both Brigham Young University and Utah Valley University.
